text: WE ARE RIGHT BEHIND THE WOMAN, who mumbles the prayer as runs. The back of her vest reads: FBI. Her name is KATE M
Give us this day... our daily bread...
They reach the door, a shotgun BLASTS THE HINGES. It fall like a drawbridge.
And forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us.
She speaks the prayer faster, desperate to finish before has to kill anyone, or be killed herself.
And lead us not into temptation but deliver us from evil...
SWAT officers rush in, screaming.
Macy's turn: She runs through the busted door-
In the hallway now. The chaos is closer. She hurries the words. So close now...
For Thine is the Kingdom the power and glory forever and ever amen DOWN MOTHER FUCKER!! DOWN DOWN DOWN!!!

Two LATINO MEN, 20'S, are slammed to the ground. Another LATINO comes from nowhere, throwing himself on an AFRICAN AMERICAN MAN wearing an FBI vest. A taser is pressed to h neck and he falls, paralyzed, backward.
Macy takes in the chaos, then pushes farther into the hou running past a bedroom with an open door.
From the corner of her eye she sees:

head_text.subj: A MAN POINTING A SHOTGUN AT HER.

text: She ducks as a SHOTGUN BLAST rips 10 inches of dry wall a her.
She turns, pressing the CAMERA against the wall. We watch over her shoulder as she returns fire.
A rooster tail of shell casings are thrown over us, invad our view. Bullet after bullet pound him. The man's knees give. He's falling...
A round hits him in the face and he is thrown back -- blo brain, and skull fragments explode like shrapnel on the w behind him.
Adrenaline hits her like a fever. She gets dizzy, sits against the wall, gasping for breath. A SWAT officer rush to her.
YOU HIT??
I'm good. I'm good.
The SWAT officer looks at the hole in the drywall. Leans forward. Looks closer... What the fuck IS that??
His face now inches from the hole then jumps back like he bitten by a snake.
WHAT THE FUCK??
The SKULL OF A MAN. Dry skin sunken into bones like cellophane.

Macy stands up and turns around. Looks at it. Trying to process what she's seeing. She walks up and starts pullin the drywall. Other officers join her. They yank and tear six foot hole in the wall, then stand back, speechless.
Bodies are standing side by side. A lime-green dust has spilled out on the floor.
The entire house is a tomb.
Macy sits on the porch. Swallows water from a bottle. Hol it down maybe ten seconds. Vomits... We see another SWAT OFFICER doing the same.
FBI AGENT REGGIE WAYNE, 30, African American, walks from house, fighting the same urge. Sits beside her.
Can't shake the smell. Just sits in you.
Yeah... Sorry I wasn't on your six. Got wrapped up in the front room.
Macy nods.
I saw.
She looks out over the sea of POLICE VEHICLES on the stre and spots PHOENIX HOMICIDE DETECTIVE LANCE ALVAREZ, 45, heading right for them.
Loan you SWAT and you hand us three dozen homicides. I oughta fucking pepper spray you.
Couldn't smell any worse.
Ha ha. You're not the one gotta clean this shit up.
Yeah. Thirty families without a father's real funny, but you keep worrying about what it does to your weekend, Lance.
Listen you fucking   --
Reggie is on his feet in an instant and inches from Lance face.
I didn't hear you, you say something?
Lance swallows his anger and his pride, walks toward the house.
Clear your people out, it's our crime scene now.
It's your crime scene when I GIVE IT TO YOU!!!
What are the chances they'll put together a case.
... None.
Look.

She turns and sees: FBI REGIONAL DIRECTOR DAVE JENNINGS, leather skin stretched over a square jaw that rests on br shoulders. Beside him is DEPUTY DIRECTOR PHIL COOPER, 40, balding and thin, exactly the man you want analyzing data
Ever seen him at a crime scene?
No.
Jennings and Phil reach her.
You okay?
I'm fine.
Wanna give me the tour?
She doesn't but she will.
No dry wall anywhere now: the walls have been stripped to frame, exposing another DOZEN BODIES. CORONERS in protect suits remove them as DETECTIVES photograph the scene. The smell is atrocious.
Looks like Sinaloa...
Jennings nods and sighs.
Yeah. (To a coroner) How many total?
Between here and the hall we have thirty, but there's more in the back bedroom and we haven't looked in the attic or under the crawl space.
(To Phil) Call DOJ in Washington, let em know what we have.
Phil nods, pulls his cell and steps away.
This one of the houses owned by Manuel Diaz?
No way to connect him, but he owns it.
The smell is getting to Reggie. Doesn't look like he's go to make it...
Go ahead and step out, it's okay.
Don't have to tell him twice.

Jennings walks to the wall. Studies the faces -- one in particular, tinted an ashy green from lye and months of d -- his mouth open wide and eyes shut so tight that his br is a tangle of wrinkles, as though he is suffering his de for eternity.

We see a GARAGE, and to it's left A STORAGE SHED. AN OFFI yanks boxes and garbage from it, tossing it on the drivew He reaches the floor, which is covered with rubber matts. pulls one up and discovers a 3' X 3' piece of plywood hin to the floor and locked.
I NEED BOLT CUTTERS.
They are brought over and the lock is cut. The officer kn down. Lifts the hatch a little. Looks under, flashlight i hand...

head_text.subj: -- WE ARE UNDERNEATH THE PLYWOOD, FLASHLIGHT IN OUR EYES

text: As the hatch is lifted -- TWO HOOKS with wires are visibl our left and right. As the hatch is lifted, the wires pul tighter... We see where they lead: TWO GRENADES.
Jennings and Macy walk down the hall. Jennings stops at t body of the man Macy killed, then notices --
Through a screen door at the end of the hall -- officers rushing toward the shed.
PD found something.
Macy and Jennings walk outside. As the sunlight hits them the officer open the hatch, the wires pull tight and we h a `clink'.

head_text.subj: -- THE GRENADES EXPLODE. TWO OFFICERS BLOWN TO OBLIVION -

text: Dust, debris, smoke, and pieces of them roll toward Jenni and Macy like a wave, swallowing them.
Our entire world is filled with a brown cloud and screams
We see children splashing and playing in a large pool thr enormous windows in MANUEL DIAZ'S living room. As we pull back, we hear the sounds of a NEWS REPORT.
Phoenix police have released no details, but there HAS BEEN an explosion at a house in South Phoenix.
CAMERA PIVOTS and we are looking at a TV across a flawles decorated living room. Aerial footage of the tract house obliterated storage plays.

You can clearly see two bodies covered in tarps but Phoenix Police will not release names or even confirm the deaths. Witnesses on the scene state that a warrant was served at the house an hour BEFORE the explosion, so the speculation is the deceased are Phoenix police

A MAN leans into frame. His head slowly shakes as he watc and listens. A cell phone rings. He answers it, mutes the and retreats out of frame, leaving us to watch the news i silence, as the sounds of children splashing and laughing wafts in through an open window.
We stare at the spout. Water washes over us. We look at t drain. Dirt, blood, and small fragments of pink, white, a navy blue circle the drain as gravity carries them to the sewers of Phoenix.
Dark brown hair is vigorously scrubbed. Macy does not rel in this shower-- that is not its purpose. The purpose is decontaminate.
Macy stands in front of the mirror, brushing her hair. Th are abrasions on her cheek and a deep cut that runs down the corner of her eye-- like she cried a scar.
The hair brush catches. Pulls her head back.
OW.
She extracts the brush. Feels around on her scalp and retrieves a piece of bone. Looks at it...
She wraps it in toilet paper, sets it on the counter, and gets back in the shower. Turns it on. Gonna try this agai
The decor is Spare. Functional and nothing more. Doesn't tease herself with pictures on the wall.
Macy walks in wearing a large men's t shirt, nothing else Her COMPUTER CHIRPS. ROSALYN4620 is asking that she chat. Macy looks at the screen.
Not tonight mom.
Keeps walking. Her cell phone rings. Call display: MOM.
Uhh... (Answers it) Mom, it was a
Everyone sure missed you today.
Macy's body tenses and deflates at the same time.
Me too. You get my card?
Get on the computer. I want to see
Mom, I just got --
It's my birthday goddammit-
I'm signing on.
She hits a button on her computer and ROSALYN MACY, 60 to appears. She leans back and forth in front of the lens, s unsure about this technology that beams her image through space.
Can you see me?
Stay in one place, Mom. Happy birthday. Sorry I didn't call-
Can you see me? I don't see you. Lean forward -- there you are... What happened to your face?
Rosalyn's happy mood is gone.
Nothing. It's something on your lens.
Kate. I can see it.
Like I said, rough day.
Silence.
What a waste of a law degree, Kate.
Macy holds her tongue, but it takes effort.
Who came to the party?
Evan sent me a card. I thought that was very sweet. Have you two spoken?
Macy sighs.
No.
Well... I hope you two will become friends.
I'm sure we'll be great friends, Mother. Nothing like a divorce to bring people closer.
Beat.
You look tired.
I am... (forces a smile) Happy birthday. How does it feel to be 60?
It would feel a lot better with a grandchild, and I don't think it's
Macy slams the laptop closed. She rubs her eyes... So tir Her cell phone rings. She flips it open, angry --
I DON'T WANT TO TALK ABOUT GRANDCHILDREN. (It isn't mom) Yeah, umm... I can, I can be there in, say thirty minutes? Yes sir.
Hangs up. Day's not over.
Macy and Reggie sit in chairs against a glass wall. NEWS FOOTAGE of the blast plays on monitors along the wall of command center filled with activity.
In the glass office behind them, a dozen men in suits. Jennings, in the same shape as Macy, has deflated into a chair, Phil sitting beside him.
Macy turns and looks through the wall at the men.
Know what's going on?
No idea.
Jennings makes eye contact with Macy through the glass. F the first time, he seems old to her.

All these men look important, except one: MATT GRAVES, 40 golf shirt, bit of a belly, red, shaggy hair -- looks lik tourist. His demeanor is easy, you almost get the sense h having fun. Macy turns around and rests her head against glass.
I need coffee.
We did this by the book, right?
Come on ... Of course.
Macy lets out a heavy breath, looks back through the glas find: every man in the room is STARING RIGHT AT HER.
Jesus.
What?(Turns around) Oh shit.
Phil walks toward them, pushes open the door.
Would you step in here, Kate?
She rises and shares a look with Reggie. The door closes behind her.
Matt smiles, friendly. A man in his 40's, military haircu BURNETT, looks her over.
Quite a find today ... The loss of two officers not withstanding.
She says nothing.
How familiar are you with Manuel Diaz's operation?
His company, Sun Valley, owns eighty or so foreclosure properties, another --
What do you know about his brother?
She looks at Matt.
Um ... Wasn't aware he had one.
Guillermo... Mexican police are holding him in Juarez. What do you know about his cousin?
Beat.
Didn't know he had one of those either.
His cousin is Fausto Alarcon.
Beat.
I don't know who that is.
Number three in the Sinaloa Cartel.
Manuel Diaz is likely their most senior member in the United States.
Macy feels woefully unprepared for an inquisition.
None of this is in his file.
With good reason.
Loose lips sink ships, Kate.
I'm not --
Agent Macy doesn't work narcotics, she runs a kidnapping response team.
You married?
I'm sorry?
Husband?
Who the fuck is this clown in the golf shirt?
Divorced.
Kids?
No. He works for Border Patrol and got to keep the condo and my Bronco, anything else?
Matt smiles. Phil stands up.
Thank you Kate, if you could wait outside, please.
She stands there for a beat, utterly confused, then leave
She sits back down next to Reggie.
... Well?
I have no clue.
We watch the men speaking through the glass, then they al file out of the office except Jennings and Matt. Phil sta at the door.
Will you come in, Kate?
She walks in and stands across from Jennings.
DOJ wants advisors that focus on cartels involved in pursuing Mr. Diaz. This is Matt Graves. He'll be
He'll be leading who? This is Phoenix Homicide now.
We're expanding the scope of the investigation.
You'll act as a liaison.
What does that mean?
State Department is pulling an agent from the field that specializes in responding to escalated cartel activity. You'll meet up with them...(To Matt) at Luke, Tomorrow?
Day after. Early.
Luke ... Air Force base?
Gonna go see Guillermo.
His brother.
That's the one.
Matt smiles, like they're discussing renovating a kitchen
Okay... If I, umm... What's our objective?
Our objective is to dramatically overreact.
Beat.
Why isn't Reggie in here?
He's a little green. You've been kicking doors longer.
She looks back at Reggie.
Makes you feel better to have him around, he can tag along after we get back from El Paso.
He smiles. She takes this in.
Kate. You must volunteer for an interagency task force... Think very hard before you respond ... You want to be a part of this?
Jennings' eyes beg her to say no. But the hunter in her i awake. She looks back at Reggie -- his eyes are full of concern...
We get an opportunity at the men responsible for today?
The men who are REALLY responsible.
Then yeah, sure. I'll volunteer.
Jennings looks at her. Nods. She is theirs now...
Morning sun hits closed eyes. Dark, fat face. Beads of sw on his brow and cheeks. Thick mustache. His name is SILVI
A SHADOW falls over him. He feels it. Eyes pop open, tens
Papa?
A smile crosses Silvio's face.
Despirtate.
No.
Silvio closes his eyes. The little boy taps him on the ch
Si.
Silvio's smile grows. It is a game.
No.
We see the boy now. He is eight. Bright brown eyes. His n is ELISEO.
SI!! Tengo un juego de futbol!
Silvio acts surprised.
Nooooo...
The boy laughs and grabs his father's hand, tugging.
Si Papa! Tenemos que ir!

The boy pulls with all his might. Silvio makes a show of resisting, then climbs out of bed. Eliseo keeps a tight h of his hand, and walks him down a hall to a small kitchen with adobe walls and a dirt floor. An opening leads to a small patio that now serves mostly as a chicken coop. Two chickens are in the kitchen.
A woman stands over a stove, cooking.
Papa necessita cafe y juevos! Tenemos priso mama!
She turns and smiles at her son, the bright star in her b life. Her eyes pass over Silvio. She stopped loving him y ago, but he adores their little boy... At least they have that.
He sits down. She scoops eggs onto a plate with tortillas drops it in front of him. Hands him a coffee. He sniffs i hands it back. Without a word she pours in two fingers of tequila.
The boy stares at his father with endless joy. No idea ho unlucky he is.
Silvio stares back, winks. The boy smiles.

Silvio and Eliseo exit the house. Silvio wears a State Po uniform, dressed to intimidate. The boy wears his uniform dressed to play soccer. They walk past cinder-block house one after the other, cracked and faded from the sun.
Tejano music, car horns, and distant yelling penetrate th morning.
Two ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIERS drive past.
Silvio and Eliseo wander away, Eliseo's tiny hand clingin Silvio's police belt. Eliseo has his father for the whole and he isn't letting go.
They turn and disappear around the corner. Only thing on street is a stray dog burying itself in an overturned tra can... The mascot of this dying city.
We are back with Alejandro, holding a man under water. Fa to the sun, somehow able to focus fully on the task at ha while escaping to someplace else.
He lets the man up. Coughing, heaving up salt water, and sobbing. He looks at Alejandro with the pleading eyes of man whose will has been broken.
Colonel Guteman. Yes...
And you too...
He nods.
Say it.
Of course me too! If the Americans would leave, you would see... no one is pure.
Alejandro lets the man up and pushes him toward the shore now see the man wears a MILITARY UNIFORM. He walks ahead Alejandro, looking back.
The man makes a half hearted attempt at attacking Alejand who pushes and spins him like a defiant child.

They walk a few steps and the man tries it again. Alejand appears only half committed to the sloppy assault. Alejan slaps the man across the face, then pushes him forward, slapping the back of his head as he does.
They reach a stump where Alejandro's linen coat rests.
Sit down.
Why?
Can't walk back like this. We need to dry.

They sit back and bathe in the sun. The man is uncomforta kidnapper and captive, lounging on the shore. He consider running. Considers fighting him again, but settles on res his tired back against the stump.
What will you do with me?
Nothing.
Beat.
Will I be arrested?
No.
What will you do with the Colonel?
Nothing. (Alejandro turns his face to the sun) I just wanted to know.
Alejandro and the man walk along a two track road through field of sugar cane.
If you tell. They will kill me... my family.
Don't give me a reason.
Beat.
How do I avoid that?
By telling me the truth without having to drown you.
They come around a bend and we see:

Structures built in simple but orderly rows. Humvees, one after the other, parked neatly in front. Soldiers move ab Colombia may be corrupt, but they are orderly about it. N of the filth and chaos of northern Mexico. They have been it much longer, with battle lines very clearly drawn.
The man turns to Alejandro.
So... that's it then?
Alejandro nods.
You act like the Narcos. You do things that I don't understand.
Alejandro offers him a polite smile.
If you are very lucky you never will.
The man walks away, turning back occasionally to see if h truly free.
Alejandro turns in another direction, spots THREE US MARI HUMVEES, EIGHT MARINES BESIDE THEM. Matt stands in front. They walk toward each other.
It is the Colonel.
We'll get to that...
Alejandro looks over the Marines.
Why so many?
Don't want anything to happen to you on the way to the airport.
Where are we going?
To keep my promise.
Alejandro's kind, hollow eyes almost show emotion.
What did they do?
Doesn't matter. It leads to Fausto. And I'm going to turn you loose.
Alejandro stands for a moment. The tiniest hint of a smil curls his lips.
Thank you.
Reggie drives, Macy riding shotgun. Through the windshiel we see the entrance to LUKE AIR FORCE BASE approaching.
You're back tonight?
Yeah. I'll call you, let you know what time.
I don't understand why they don't want me there...
She deflects.
It's El Paso... Don't think you're missing much.
Well... you keep your eye on that doughy prick in the golf shirt...
She smiles.
I'm supposed to worry about you.
This isn't what we do, Kate.
We do what we need to do.
Reggie pulls to the guard post, hands over their ID's. An FORCE MP takes them, compares ID's to a list.
(To Reggie) You're not on here.
I know. What's she supposed to do?
Walk.
Macy opens the door and steps out.
I'll call you when we're heading back.
She walks around the front of the Tahoe and disappears wi the MP into the guard house.
Macy walks toward the runways, looking around, unsure whe to go.
Kate.
She turns, sees Matt.
This way.
Am I late?
No. We just landed.
She walks to him and they head off. Alejandro sits on a bench, patiently. They walk to him.
This is my bird dog, his name's Alejandro.
He stands.
Hello.
Kate Macy.
Alejandro studies her.
Have you been to Juarez before?
No... Wait, we're going to El Paso, right?
Yeah, we'll talk about it on the plane.
He walks off, they follow. He leads them to a GULFSTREAM G650.
We're taking this?
Yeah.
Really... Okay...
They climb in.

They strap themselves in as the pilot speaks with the tow Macy sits beside Alejandro. Studies him. He looks like a doctor or accountant, but there is an absent manner to hi actions, as though nothing warrants his full attention bu the weight of his thoughts. He catches her looking at him
What is your experience with operations like these?
None... What IS the operation?
He gives her a polite smile.
Sleep if you can. Juarez will demand all of your focus.
He lays his head back and closes his eyes. Macy looks at Matt.
Are we going into Juarez?
Shakes his head. Could be interpreted as a `no'.
DOD flies around in Gulfstreams now?
You guys don't have one?
She laughs.
Right... Food on this flight?
They got some bitchin peanuts in the back. Kind of a self-serve deal though.
He puts his head back, closes his eyes. She looks over at Alejandro who is already asleep. Macy's wired. No chance sleep. Pulls a magazine from the seat back as the plane begins to taxi...
WE SEE: Alejandro's face in profile. Sunlight spilling ov him through a small window. He looks different. Softer... Happy...
DARK BROWN HAIR lowers into frame toward him. He pushes i back, revealing a young woman. She smiles and kisses him. lets her hair fall as the kiss grows. Dark hair fills the frame...
It gets very still. Darker now. Sunlight is gone. We PULL BACK. Farther. Farther still. See the woman's body. She l face down in a hallway, naked. Blood pooled beneath her.

We hear a HEART BEAT. We move down a hall. Heart beating FASTER. Past a MEXICAN POLICE OFFICER, who somberly watch us... At the end of the hall we hear something rubbing, swaying. We move faster. Heart beats faster. Racing now.

Come to the end of the hall, the SWAYING IS LOUDER. We tu left, push open a door. Look up -- The swaying sound is a ROPE. It swings in and out of frame. We follow it down -- LIFELESS BODY OF A YOUNG GIRL at the end of it.
Alejandro jolts awake, slamming his hands into the seat i front of him -- scaring the living shit out of Macy.
JESUS!!
Alejandro looks straight ahead.
You okay?
Doesn't look at her. Sweat rolls down his face.
Yes.
She keeps looking at him. He turns to her.
I'm fine.
We hear the pilot announce their initial descent into El Paso's FORT BLISS. Alejandro leans back in his seat.
So... This is your specialty.
Hmm?
He said the cartels in Mexico are your specialty.
Yes.
Anything I should know?
You are asking how a watch works. For now, only focus on knowing the time.
Alejandro lays his head back. Closes his eyes. Macy mumbl to herself.
Okay... Yoda.
Alejandro, Macy, and Matt walk off the plane, blinded by desert sun.
A man in his late 30's, mustache, DEA AGENT STEVE FERSING waves from inside a BLACK CHEVY TAHOE. They walk over and climb in.
How you been?
Good. Trying to get DOD to let me look into this conspiracy to sink Figi.
Steve chuckles.
It's the damn terrorists. They're sinking all the tropical islands.
I figure a month or two there, I could get it worked out.
Hear there's a real drug problem at the Four Seasons there. You need any help looking into it...
Yeah, I'll keep you posted... who's going over today?
Marshals, DEA. Pulled a team for you.
I get all warm and fuzzy when you say `team'.
It's a crack bunch too. Just rotated back from Afghanistan.
Where's everybody linking up?
Army Intelligence Center.
Macy listens intently, trying to figure out what the hell they're talking about. Alejandro looks out across the bor Alejandro seems different. He is somewhere else. Somewher bad.
TWENTY FOOT WALLS surround the center. A GUARD POST in fr of an enormous closed gate.
The Tahoe pulls up... A guard, dressed like he is on miss in Afghanistan, steps forward.
ID's all around. Hey Steve.
Even Steve hands his ID. The guard returns to the guard h with the IDs. Matt turns around and faces Macy.
Thought you were in the big time in Phoenix... welcome to Baghdad.
The guard returns with their IDs.
Be safe.
The gate opens and they pull in.

There must be fifty vehicles, most are unmarked SUVs, but dozen Humvees and six ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIERS, complet with 20mm cannons. The area is alive with activity. Agent deputies, and special forces operators are moving about.
The Tahoe parks and our team gets out. They follow Steve toward the entrance to:

A US MARSHAL stands in front of a video screen showing th route into and out of Juarez. Twenty men seated in chairs None wear uniforms, but all wear tactical vests, drop-leg holsters, assault rifles by there side. It sounds and loo like a military operation.
They take a seat in the back. Macy the men seated around
Pay attention.
She is surprised by the directive, turns her focus to the speaker.

Mexican Federal Police will meet you at the border and proceed with you to the courthouse located (Pointing on map) here. This is a high level target. The most likely spot for an attempt will be at the exchange and the border. The Marshals will enter -- Kevin, Keith, wanna stand up?

Two men in their 50's stand up. They look like they were teleported from another time -- starched white shirts und bullet proof vests, starched Wranglers, bone colored cowb hats, and faces tough as boot leather. They turn to the r without smiling.
(Smiling) Man, I love Texans.
Alejandro whispers to her.
Memorize the faces of everyone here. Know who is with you.
Marshals' response team is in Laredo so, our friends from Delta have volunteered to come along and will escort the Marshals at the exchange.
The Marshal speaking notices Matt in the back.
Here's the man of the hour. You coming or waiting here?
Sure, we'll take the tour. Loan me a couple of pop guns?
This is turning into an All-Star affair. Wanna another hand at the exchange, Keith?
(To Matt) You sober?
Matt laughs.
I will be by the time we get there.
I got a bottle in the truck in case yer hands git to shakin.
I miss your hospitality, Keith.
Turns to Macy.
Guess we're going sightseeing.
Macy looks very uncomfortable.

Alright. So, and we'll gear you up when we're done, Matt -- you can be the tip of the spear and we don't have to rob a guy from Delta... Be careful on the turn-around -- if a Federale is a shooter it will be on the turn around. Ray, your Team 1 is lead vehicle and we can divide team 2 into the carry car and the trail vehicles, that okay?
A man with a short beard and very broad shoulders nods.
Ray, If Delta could stand up so everyone can see who to stand behind if the shit hits the fan...
Everyone laughs. The Delta operators rise. Though this is room of professionals, these men truly look like the ones want to stand behind.

Most likely spot for a hit is at the border crossing on the return. State Police has agree to hold a lane for you. Heads up if they don't... Anywhere along the way, anyone not in this room is a potential shooter. This op isn't over until we are back here, okay? Be aware, be vigilant, and stay alert. Let's go.
Men begin rising and readying their gear. The mood is relaxed. Matt walks to the Marshal -- they shake hands an disappear in the back.
Ever been over there?
He looks at her and offers a smile.
I worked in Juarez.
For the DEA?
No.
He offers nothing further.
For who?
Mexico. As a federal prosecutor.
You're not American?
No.
She tries to make sense of that.
Who do you work for now?
Alejandro smiles.
I go where I'm sent.
Where were you sent FROM?
Cartagena.
... Colombia?
Alejandro nods.
Matt emerges from the other room carrying two M4 carbines a Kevlar vest. Macy sees him and marches to him.
(Handing her the vest) See if this fits.
(Pointing toward Alejandro) Is he CIA? Are you?
Try it on.
Well?
He's a DOD advisor, just like me.
She doesn't budge, holds his gaze.
Pay attention to Alejandro -- he says do something, do it.
She takes that as a `yes'.
I'm not authorized to --
Fine. Stay here.
She shifts her weight. Hesitates...
But you don't want to, do you?
I just wanna know what I'm getting

You asked to get on this train. Because you KNOW you're not stopping anything in Phoenix. You're just sweeping up the mess. In six months, every house you raid will be rigged with explosives... You want to find the men responsible? This is where we start.
He walks off.
After a moment, she follows.
FIVE CHEVY TAHOES, sirens on the dashboard move through E Paso.
We watch from above as they cut their way through traffic
Macy sits in the back beside Alejandro. He holds a rifle between his legs, barrel pointed down. Macy notices his r hand -- his finger rests on the button that rolls down th window.
So how nervous should I be?
The DEA Agent riding shotgun turns back to her.
Are you kidding?
He points out the window.
Over there? That's the beast.
He turns back, facing front.
She looks out the window to Juarez. It is so close, you c throw a frisbee into it.
THE CONVOY turns onto the BRIDGE OF THE AMERICAS. Border Agents have closed the left lane to traffic, in preparati for the convoy's arrival.
From above, we see MEXICO. Some THIRTY FEDERAL POLICE TRU SOLDIERS FILLING THE BEDS are waiting for them.
The convoy drives straight through -- the Mexican Police trucks roll forward as our convoy catches up to them.

The city of Juarez is   itself a crime. Filthy and crumbl hookers and criminals   fill every possible space of side They are as plentiful   as the unfortunate masses that ar condemned to live and   work here.

head_text.subj: SIRENS BLARE. POLICE YELL OVER LOUD SPEAKERS AND THROUGH
MEGAPHONES FOR VEHICLES TO PULL OVER AND LET THE CONVOY P

text: SWEAT rolls down Macy's face. She can feel her heart beating... Loud enough she actually wonders if others hea too.
At every turn, it seems there are soldiers and police. A large group of police can be seen on a side-street, stand around a car -- a DEAD BODY on the street beside it.
Macy sees a woman in her 20's SPRINTING down the street, SCREAMING, though there is no one chasing her.
Alejandro taps her on the shoulder, motions her to scoot toward him.
Want to see Juarez?
He points to A BRIDGE WHERE THE BODY OF A MAN HANGS, a do soldiers looking down at it.
As we look closer, we see he has been decapitated -- his replaced with that of a pig, crudely sewn to his body wit fishing line.
The body is naked from the waist down -- a state police s on his torso.
As the convoy races up the street, the bridge and it's swinging corpse come closer.
Hard to believe, yes?
(Breathless) Yes.
He wears the state police shirt. The pig -- Not what you think it means. All state police work for the cartels. ALL of them. That man... He tried to work for two... he got greedy.
They continue past. Into an even worse part of Juarez, if that's possible. The vehicles come to a stop. POPPING SOU can be heard. Like fireworks.
Hear that?
He cracks his window. The sound floods in. GUNFIRE. Not t shots, not fifty. Hundreds. It is a battle. Over the radi HEAR:
Everybody hold on. Mexicans are adjusting our route. There's activity ahead we need to go around.
We sit here, listening to the gunfight as it builds in intensity. We hear a series of explosions.
Both agents in the front seats reposition their rifles. Ready.
The convoy rolls again. Makes a left, drives away from th battle as though they were avoiding road construction. A blocks and they all snake right. Macy is trying hard not be terrified.
Suddenly, the convoy picks up speed. Moving 70mph over a that barely qualifies as two lanes.
They race past a park. A large building can be seen on th right. The Mexican flag flies in front. Numerous Federal Police vehicles in front.
The convoy stops in front and the Delta operators are out their vehicles, setting a perimeter. The Marshals and Mat emerge and move straight to the building, two Deltas foll
Macy stays glued to the front door of the building. Waiti Alejandro shifts in his seat toward Macy.

Nothing will happen here. If they try anything, it will be at the border. If no lane is cleared for us when we return... Be ready. Watch the cars. Look for old cars. Throw aways. Not gangster cars... Those are for the whores on Saturday night. Did you watch the cars we passed driving in?
She shakes her head `no'
Watch for state police. They are all bad. We will lose the escort at the loop. You will see. That is when you worry.
Matt and the Marshals come out with a man covered in a blanket. He is placed in the backseat.
The federal Police begin turning their vehicles.
NOW.

Suddenly, the Tahoe lurches forward -- moving between the vehicle with Matt and the Marshals -- acting as a shield. Macy looks out the window at the Federal Police trucks. S notices the agent riding shotgun has his rifle at the rea in the direction of the Federal Police.
Lean back, Kate.
She turns to find him pointing his rifle almost at her he She leans back, and moves her hands toward her ears, read cover them.
Jesus.
Okay. Go.
The Tahoe begins moving and performs a lighting fast thre point turn, and just like that we are headed north.
Macy lets out an endless sigh of relief. We are driving v fast now.
Macy looks out the windshield, the hills of El Paso loom the distance.
On the left.
Two streets over, as buildings whip by, we see a STATE PO VEHICLE even with us.
It disappears as buildings fill our view, then at the nex block we see it again. We hear over the radio --
We have a spotter on the left everyone. Keep your eyes out for a strike vehicle.
The driver speaks into his radio.
Mexico holding a lane for us at the border?
That's my understanding. We're trying to confirm...
As we race to the border, the state police vehicle has DISAPPEARED.
We come to the loop, the last exit before being fed into twelve lanes leading only to the border crossing...
At the loop, the Mexican Federal Police vehicles peel off leaving the convoy alone. At the border, US HOMELAND SECU OFFICERS can be seen standing with rifles, making a very public show of force.
There is no lane cleared for them, and just like that -- are trapped in traffic.
Everyone stay in this lane. Our agents at the border are going to wave everyone through and get us over as quick as they can.
The agents at the border aren't even checking passports, moving cars through in the lane where the convoy is trapp but there are fifty cars ahead of them...
Alejandro looks out his window and sees, two lanes over:
FOUR MEN in an old Buick LeSabre. They are staring straig ahead. All drenched in sweat.
Alejandro taps Macy, she scoots closer.
You have a service weapon?
Yes.
Get it out.
She unholsters her pistol.
Silver LeSabre. Two lanes over my 3.
Yep.
He takes the radio.
Silver LeSabre, two lanes right, 3 o'clock.
One lane over right, 5 o'clock. Burgundy Expedition.
Three lanes over right, 1 o'clock, green honda civic.
Macy grips her pistol.
Okay... okay...
Then Alejandro spots it.
Gun. Buick LeSabre, 3 o'clock, gun.
The flash suppressor of an AK 47 is peeking out in the ba seat. A sweaty, young gunman holds the rifle between his legs.
What are the rules here?
We must be engaged to engage.
Can we get out of this vehicle and set a perimeter?
Stay in your vehicle. You can do what they do. If they get out you can get out.
(To Macy) watch the door handles.
The cars are beginning to move in the convoy's lane. Anot fifteen seconds and they can leave this hell behind.
Get ready. They can see our lane clearing. If it's coming, it's coming now.
Only a few more cars and the convoy is clear. But that wo mean luck is on their side and luck doesn't live on this of the border.
The doors to the Expedition swing open. By the time the assassins put a foot to the ground, the Delta operators a out of their cars and halfway to them, rifles raised.
Before Macy can react, she is ALONE in the Tahoe.
Even the driver has exited... she is starting to panic.
Think... think...
She looks at her pistol, grips it tight. And goes nowhere
Okay...
The assassins are frozen, guns by their sides. A dozen Americans have weapons trained on them.
The Agent riding shotgun stands in front of the Buick, ri pointed at the windshield. Other operators are at the fla of the Civic before their doors are even open.
But at the Expedition, men are already out, weapons in th hands.

The delta operators and Alejandro are yelling at the men Spanish. One retreats to the safety of the back seat, but others know the consequences of a failed hit and they are in checkmate like those in the other cars...
The assassins, none over twenty years old, yell and cuss threaten as the operators surround them in a semicircle.
The assassin that exited the drivers seat -- 2 carat diam earrings and no shirt on his skinny chest -- screams in hateful defiance at the operators surrounding him.

He raises his weapon and ALEJANDRO AND THE OPERATORS FIRE He is obliterated -- They continue firing, surgically kil all the Expedition's crew. Bullets ping through the windshield. Bullets tear the Expedition to shreds. The assassins never fire a shot.
The innocent masses stuck in the crossfire duck out of vi in their vehicles. The streets are instantly empty.
The noise of the shooting echoes off the asphalt with the force of thunder.
Macy watches through the back window.
WHAT THE FUCK ARE WE DOING                        !

The men watching the other vehicles hold targets in their sights. The rest will take their chances with the boss. D even look in the direction of the Americans -- just stare straight ahead, sweating...
The operators and Alejandro work their way back to the vehicle. Everyone retreats to their cars.
The kid with the AK 47 in the back of the Buick makes a m for his door handle. Alejandro clocks it, puts 10 rounds through the window, killing him and the man beside him be the door is opened.
Macy turns away in shock to find:

head_text.subj: A MEXICAN STATE POLICE OFFICER 5 FEET FROM HER WINDOW

text: He raises an AK 47 to his shoulder -- pointed right at he Before she can think, her gun is raised and firing throug the tinted window.
The sound is deafening. As the man falls out of view, all can hear is the RINGING IN HER EARS.
Alejandro and the agent riding shotgun jump in and roll t windows down and sit out of them like turrets as the vehi start up and race to the border.

They pass the guard house without stopping, Border Agents waving them onward through the finish line. More agents p weapons and scream at the Mexican State police officers w have emerged from their offices.
It is absolute madness...
Alejandro and the agent sit back in the vehicles and roll the windows... They are back in America.
Macy struggles to get her breath. No one speaks. After a beat...
This is going to be on the front page of every newspaper in America.
No it won't. It won't even make the paper in El Paso...
The convoy is safe. It races past traffic, red sirens lighting the dashboards...
The vehicles pull in and park. Agents and operators exit vehicles and amble toward the entrance.
Macy gets out, her head spinning.
Matt walks up to her. She holds out a hand, begging him a
JUST... Give me a minute.
Yeah. That got a little nutty, huh?
No. No. Don't... NO. This isn't ... This was a SPECIAL OP. You're a fucking spook. And HIM!! Who the fuck is that??
She points at Alejandro.
He lets her vent. Burning the unused adrenaline.
Hey. I told you to stay here...
I'm not qualified for this. I'm good at what I do, but I'm not a soldier.
Don't sell yourself short. Reason Reggie's home is I know he's not ready for this, but he's gonna have to get ready real quick, because this is the future. Juarez is what happens when they dig in...
Don't put me in a situation where I have to break the law to stay alive. Don't do that to me.
Steve walks up to Matt.
You wanna get cracking?
On that note, I think you better stay out here.
Matt winks and walks in the building, leaving Macy alone the motor pool.

A door opens and we find GUILLERMO, 45, fat, three day stubble, and very unhappy to be here. His hands are cuffe behind his back. A DEA AGENT holds a bottle of water that Guillermo sucks like an infant.
Matt walks in.
Giving him a belly full of water... you devil.
Matt smiles, the agent smiles back.
Matt sits in the only other chair in the room.
Didn't think we'd get you here, did you?
I love it when they don't hablo. Brought an old buddy of yours. Bet you `hablo' to him.
The door opens and Alejandro walks in, carrying two five gallon jugs of water. It takes Guillermo a minute, then horror washes over his face.
El Medellin.
Alejandro, he remembers you.
No expression on Alejandro's face.
The DEA Agent moves to the door.
I'm gonna step out.
He closes the door behind him. The red `record' button on camera mounted in the corner goes out. We notice a DRAIN THE FLOOR.

Alejandro walks toward Guillermo, stands across from him. Places a foot on his chest. Pushes... Hard... Guillermo s back, like a chopped tree. He moves through frame in slow motion, falling out of frame.
Macy leans against a car. Spots a guy with a cigarette.
Hey. Got another one of those?
He gives her one. Lights it. She draws in, coughs.
Been a while. Thanks.
Like fireworks?
She turns and sees a Delta operator. Holding a pair of BINOLULARS.
Come here.
She follows him. They walk to the back of the motor pool stairway that leads to the roof of the building. He goes She hesitates.
Up to you.
She takes the bait. Climbs up.
They sit on the edge of the roof, facing Juarez. He begin glassing the area.
Fireworks is code for something, I assume.
Sort of.
He glasses. She smokes, waiting for the other shoe to dro
Here we go.
He hands her the binoculars.
Look right there.

head_text.subj: --THROUGH THE BINOCULARS WE LOOK OVER JUAREZ--

text: She sees it. Muzzle flashes. Right on the street. Rifle f glowing white against the muddy gray of Juarez at dusk. G as fast as it came. She looks at Delta.
Keep looking.
She begins scanning the city. Sirens. Everywhere. She see another muzzle flash. She looks up.
I don't hear anything.
Can't. Too far away. Keep looking. They're everywhere.
She scans the city slowly. Sirens. More sirens. The city lit in a throbbing red and blue.
Unbelievable.
Madness, huh.
He bums a drag from her cigarette. They sit in silence an watch the city go to war.
Macy, Matt, and Alejandro walk through the parking lot. M is exhausted. Matt's on his cell phone.
Can they get them all in one place? No... I'm on a clock now, I can't wait... No, contact Bob Fiske. Have him hold all of them at the staging center.( Turns to Macy) How far is Tuscon?
From here? Little over two hours.
We'll be there a little after 2.
Not what Macy wanted to hear.
We're going to Tucson?
You gotta learn how to sleep on a plane.
Reggie leans against the Tahoe. Not very happy.
They let me on the base when this peckerwood needs a ride, don't they?
(Pleasant as can be) Has nothing to do with your race. I just don't believe you're good enough at your job yet to be of any use. Kate's sure fond of you, though.
Thanks, man. I feel much better now.
Reggie spots Alejandro.
Who's that.
Macy shakes her head, doesn't have the strength to go int it.
We're going to Tucson.
Matt and Alejandro get in the back seat of the Tahoe. We in on Alejandro's emotionless face.
Now?
She nods and yawns at the same time. Reggie takes her in.
Hey... How was it?
Bad.
What happened?
She moves toward the front of the car.
Now's not the time.
They climb in. Reggie looks over at Macy staring out the window, resting her heavy head on her fist. He looks back Matt and Alejandro, both already asleep.
The team walks from their parked car toward an irate BOB FISKE, 40'S, walking toward them.
What's the deal, Matt? Why you holding up my transports?
We'll be quick.
I have to feed these bastards when we hold em. Know how an internal auditor responds to an eight thousand dollar check to fucking Domino's Pizza?
You're so dramatic, Bob. This is Kate Macy with the FBI, and her partner `what's his name'... It was her call.
Doesn't introduce Alejandro and Bob doesn't ask- Kate notices.
I don't even know what we're doing here. (Pointing to his cigarette) Got another one of those?
Finish it before we get inside.
He gives her one, lights her as they walk. The giant, dom warehouse growing closer. The dull murmur of four hundred people talking and sitting and moving and complaining is wafting out like an odor.
Macy tries to suck the entire cigarette in one drag. Regg leans into her.
What happened in El Paso? Talk to me.
We weren't in El Paso.
... Where were you?
We were in Mexico.
Reggie stops. Macy doesn't. She reaches the door and flic the smoke on the ground.
The illegals have been separated by sex and criminal reco
Women on the left... The worker bees -- the busboys and landscapers and construction workers -- are in the center and in the back, lined up against the wall, the felons...
Three dozen HOMELAND SECURITY AGENTS   stand over them wi M4s.
There you go. I'm starting the buses. When you're done with em, send em out.
All the women can go.
Coulda told me that on the phone, Matt.
First I've heard it.
They head toward the group of felons and the like as the women are moved out to the buses.
Watch these men close. Look for the ones like the men you saw in Juarez.

Macy looks at him. His kind, sad demeanor seems to settle her. She knows he is offering her something, just doesn't know why. She turns to the men against the wall. They hav their hands behind their backs, zip tied.
Do you see?
She scans their faces. Many have tattoos, shaved heads. A boy, maybe 18, haircut like a pop star from the 90's. Dia earrings, stares hard at her.
Him.
Alejandro nods.
Yes. Keep looking.

She studies more faces. The ones that look like American gangsters- they look down, away, no eye contact. But the with mustaches no longer in style, hair parted down the middle, the lanky teens with Polo shirts, they stare defiantly. No fear of consequence from American officers. subtle as the differences are- how they wear their pants, they lean against the wall... she understands now.
Yeah. I see it.
She turns to Alejandro, but he is gone. She turns around he stands thirty feet back beside Matt, looking over the migrants.
Macy walks back to them.
What are we looking for?
Two ways to find drug routes. You can play cat and mouse with those clowns, or ask these guys what trails they avoid.
They walk toward the largest group, the simple migrants. ones that are filthy, tired. Eager to either be sent back Mexico or go to work.
They see it all, and must avoid the traps set everywhere for them. We look for one who is older... one who has had enough.
Bob walks up.
You done with these behind you?
All yours.
The Agents begin yelling and marching the smuggler group Alejandro turns to Bob.
Break them into groups of four, Let them spread out, each group as far from the other as possible.
Bob huddles his agents and begins explaining as Matt and Alejandro walk off.
We see Reggie, observing from the entrance. He's had enou `not knowing', walks to Macy.
What are we doing here?(Looks her over) What were you doing in Mexico??
I'm with you, alright. I don't have answers.
Well, let's get some then.
She looks at him.
You think I haven't asked these questions. Think you can do better? MATT. Can we talk to you for a minute?
He starts walking toward them. They head for the open warehouse door.
Macy and Reggie stop in the center of the parking lot. Ma catches up to them.
This feels very serious.
What are we looking for? There's in the dark and then there's the way you're treating us. I want to know the objective, or I walk. Period.
Then go. I didn't ask you to be a part of this. She did.
I walk too.
Reggie stares at Matt, who casually smiles, pacifying the children.
What would you like to know?
Everything.
Guillermo told us about a tunnel east of Nogales, near Sasabe. So now, we're trying to find what areas near there migrants avoid. Because that's where the tunnel will be. Better?
Guillermo is...?
Matt laughs.
I'm going back in.
He turns.
He TOLD you where a drug tunnel is... Just... Told you.
Guillermo didn't have any other options. We send him back across the border and he's a dead man. Had to give us something.
He just smiles...
Bullshit.
Look man, we have a boss, and you ain't him. Be straight. What are you doing?
We're going to make enough noise that Manuel Diaz is called back to Mexico to see HIS boss.
And then?
And then we know where his boss is.
Fausto Alarcon, Manuel's cousin... Manuel's boss... He is an executioner...
Alejandro stands beside them, but looks out over the blac desert.
When people die in my country, it is with his hand or his blessing. To find him would be like... discovering a vaccine. Manuel will lead us to him.
His kind, hollow eyes meet Reggie's. Alejandro manufactur smile.
Certainly, you understand the value of that.
Alright... We're good. Just don't keep us in the dark.
There is only dark, my friend.
Reggie studies this strange, sad man. Looks at him with something between fear and mistrust. Macy just looks tire and mad. Matt takes them both in.
What happens when you find him?
But Alejandro is already walking back to the warehouse.
It's been a humdinger of a day. Go home. Get some rest. We'll find a ride. See you tomorrow.
Matt turns and walks back.
I just drove a hundred fucking miles...
This is a blessing, trust me. I want to stop and get some cigarettes.
Got you smoking again... it was that bad?
She moves to the car.
Worse.
Reggie watches Matt walk back in the warehouse, trying desperately to play catch up. Wondering why no one, his partner included, will tell him anything...
Reggie drives down an empty interstate 19. Up ahead, he s a TRUCK STOP.
Not that I think you should, but if you want cigarettes --
He looks over -- she is sound asleep. He drives past the truck stop, tail lights fading into the desert...
Macy lays in bed watching the blades of her ceiling fan i their endless revolution. She rises -- dressed in pajamas last -- and heads to the kitchen.
She pours a cup of coffee, heads to her computer. Pulls u the CNN website, scrolls the news, nothing about a shoot- on the border.
Goes to the El Paso newspaper website. Nothing there eith She googles SHOOT OUT, JUAREZ... is bombarded with images
Her screen is flooded with photos: women naked, tortured, beaten. Breasts cut off, pinkish flesh exposed.
Bodies of men in ditches, dead in chairs, dead in cars... dead everywhere. But nothing of yesterday. The images inv her. Can't look anymore...
She digs up a cigarette, goes to her screen door, opens i and steps out, lights her smoke.
She sees Reggie pull up and park. She yells down to him.
What's up?
You're phone's off.
Yep.
We gotta go. Those spooks been calling me all morning.
Want some coffee?
We gotta go.
I have to get dressed. Come up.
Reggie leans against the dining room table, cup of coffee hand. Macy moves from her bathroom, slacks on and only an old, off white bra. He notices. Doesn't hide it.
Gotta get you a new bra, woman.
List of things I need is almost infinite.
Just saying. You gotta... some nice lacy something.
She walks in the room, buttoning the last of her shirt.
Been so long since anyone's seen me in a bra, except you... don't look at me like that. No pity, thank you.
How was seeing Evan the other day?
...I don't know.
Miss him?
Guy works eighty hours a week and thinks I'm too focused on my job.
Mmhmm. And what does that tell you?
Beat.
Ask me something else.
Beat.
What was it like? On the border.
She turns to him. How do you describe it...
It's broken ... The whole place. Just ... Lost.
He absorbs that.
Wish you hadn't volunteered for this.
Me too. But... I have to know.
Know what?
Could it get that bad here?
Well, you sure picked the mother fuckers to show us.
Yeah...
Reggie and Macy knock on the door. It opens. Matt, dresse for golf, stands there with a slurpee.
Come on in.

They walk into the `suite', the best a motel room can be. walls are covered with TOPO MAPS of Arizona, ROAD MAPS, a GEOLOGICAL MAPS... Alejandro sits at a table with FOUR MIGRANTS from the warehouse. Worker bees.
Alejandro points to a spot on the map with a chopstick fr their take out.
You can't cross there.
Points somewhere else.
There is okay.
But the coyotes there are crooked. No women can cross there...
Alejandro looks at Matt.
We should watch here.
Alejandro points to another spot, just across the border Sasabe, Mexico.
All the migrants say `No!' In unison, even laughing at th notion.
That is drug land. The only people that cross there are forced to. To keep the Border patrol busy.
You try to cross there, they will kill you. And for a woman... a rape tree for her.
That is for their tunnels. Never cross where there is tunnels.
You know this land? A tunnel where cars can pass?
Oh yeah. For years, the best place to cross... right here.
He points to a depression on the TOPO MAP.
This arroyo? You can walk it all the way to highway 86. There is shade and a spring -- here. But a tunnel is there now. Don't go there...
Reggie's jaw is on the floor.
Are you getting this?
Yeah. I don't believe it, but I understand what they're saying.
Can you mark the tunnel on here?
Hands him a pen.
Sure. It's been a while. Three years. They made me dig for a month to cross. I snuck out one night and ran... They hide the entrance behind an old car.
Guillermo was telling the truth.
Alejandro looks at Matt.
This is our way across. Right here.(Back to the migrants) Where do you live?
East of the airport.
Matt spoons the last of his slurpee. Turns to Macy.
How good is your Spanish?
Not great.
Mine is. How did you get all this?
Matt smiles, spooning himself slurpee.
Power of persuasion.
Know a Wells Fargo on Baseline?

No cabron. We drive to Cave Creek for the bank. There is a Wells Fargo on Baseline, but it is a narco bank. The narcos hit you as you walk to it... Only the Salvadorans use it, cuz they don't know... the soldiers deposit narco money there. They will rob you cabron, to make up for what they skimmed. No, you have to bank up by the white cowboys, that is safest.
(Looks at Matt) Guillermo told the truth about everything.
We're gonna have a good day.(Points to the migrants) Let's send these guys home.
Border patrol's not down there.
Think they'd tell us all this and then go back to Mexico? You get one night's sleep and forget everything?
Thank you ... don't cross again. Not for a long time.
The migrant looks down at a small card in his hand. The others have them as well.
These green cards are good?
Better than good, my friend.
The men get up casually and walk out, sipping their soft drinks. Matt looks at Macy.
Have friends at Phoenix SWAT?
Yeah, we use them for breeches when HRT is busy.
They any good?
Yeah... they get a lot of practice.
He nods.
Got a new frame of reference for practice now, don't you. Let's give Phoenix SWAT a call, shall we?
(To Alejandro) What did you find out?
He lays a hand on her shoulder. The intimacy of the gestu surprises her.
We are close.

head_text.subj: WE ARE LOOKING THROUGH A TELEPHOTO LENS.

text: We watch a MAN, 20'S, BAGGY JEANS, WHITE T-SHIRT, sitting the curb, fiddling with an IPhone.
We taking him when he makes the grab?
When he comes out of the bank. We need the deposit receipt to seize the account. Let him do the assault... we hit him when he comes out.
Through the lens we see A WOMAN, 50's, waddling up. The y man approaches her. He's talking to her. She shakes her h He discreetly punches her in the kidney.
She reacts, then reaches into her purse. She hands him ca then kneels down and begins writing something on a piece paper.
What is she doing?
Endorsing over her paycheck.
She stands and walks the other way, holding her side. The young man walks in the bank.
PULL BACK and reveal, we are:
Matt, Reggie, Macy, Alejandro, and CORY, 35, SWAT SERGEAN Two other SWAT officers, and a MAN IN A SUIT.
Can we get in position?
When he walks out of the bank, we pull beside and you take him.
The young man walks out of the bank and is moving down th street. We are moving now.
Now.
(Into a radio) Take him.
We see TWO PHOENIX PD VEHICLES round the corner. The van doors are thrown open and Cory and his guys are on the ru The young man turns but by the time he does, Cory has tac him.
The man in the suit, Reggie, and Macy get out. Alejandro Matt stay in the van.
You have any weapons?
He's frisking him. Finds a small bag of meth, the cell ph and the bank receipt.
Where's uh... what's his name.
Here.
He hands him the bank receipt and the man disappears inside...
Cory continues digging and finds five thousand in cash on young man.
Little walking money, sport?
Macy takes this all in. A crime she didn't even know exis She walks back to the van.
You guys coming?
Matt shakes his head `no'.
Don't go in the bank, Kate.
This is something I can actually build a case on.
She turns and walks in.
We hold on a PRINTOUT OF ACCOUNT ACTIVITY.
Deposit. Deposit. Deposit. Deposit. Every day. The accoun balance around two million dollars.
These are all Manuel Diaz's accounts?
Yeah. Look here.
Macy and Reggie are leaning over him.
Cash Deposits coming in daily, the balance transferred to a money market account in 9000 dollar increments. All cash transactions 10,000 and over must be reported to
And you can seize that.

Already have. I'll go through these wire transfer numbers and freeze all these accounts as well... this is a really big bust. I don't know why we've never tried this before. Who knew they just stood outside banks and robbed people, then deposited the money...
Macy and Reggie ask themselves the same question.
A WELLS FARGO MANAGER walks over some more paperwork. The in the suit looks it over.
Wow.
What?
Know what this is?
He shows her a printout.
No.
It's a bank line of credit. You make payments over what you owe and it doesn't show as cash it shows as a negative loan balance... See that?
He points to the loan amount.
Oh my god.
Macy walks out of the bank and straight to the van, Reggi right behind.
